Job Description: We are seeking a skilled Manual Tester who will play a crucial role in ensuring the quality and reliability of our software products. The ideal candidate will possess strong expertise in functional and non-functional testing, meticulous test case design, thorough test execution, and effective defect tracking. Experience with web applications is essential, with additional preference for mobile application testing, and proficiency in SQL and database testing is a must.
Requirements:
Strong experience in web applications is mandatory.
 Strong experience in functional & non-functional testing is required.
 Strong experience in test case design and test execution is essential.
 Strong experience in defect tracking is a must.
 Strong experience in test case design techniques is required.
 Knowledge of SQL & database testing is mandatory.
 Experience in using Bugzilla/JIRA tools is essential.
 Experience in API testing is required.
Responsibilities:
Manual testing expertise will be applied to perform comprehensive functional and non-functional testing of software applications.
 Test case design skills are essential for creating robust and effective test cases, utilizing various design techniques.
 Test execution abilities are crucial for meticulously executing test cases and documenting results.
 Defect tracking proficiency is required to identify, log, and manage software defects, using tools like Bugzilla or JIRA.
 Bug reporting skills are vital for filing detailed bug reports, including analysis and root cause identification.
 SQL and database testing knowledge will be utilized to verify data integrity and functionality at the database level.
Skills:
Knowledge of automation testing (Selenium) is an added advantage.
 Experience with mobile applications will be an added advantage.
 Experience with API testing tools (Rest Client) is an added advantage.
 Experience in the Energy domain is preferred.

Job Description:

 - Participate in end-to-end implementations, migrations, and rollouts of SAP S/4HANA Controlling (CO) Module
 
 - Customize and optimize Controlling processes, including Cost Center Accounting, Profit Center Accounting, Internal Orders, Product Costing, Material Ledger, Actual Costing and Margin Analysis.
 
 - Gather business requirements, conduct fit-gap analysis, and design system solutions.

Transfer business requirements into functional specification and take it through complete life cycle of development from blueprint to go live starting with identification of gaps
 
 - Configure the system to align with business processes.
 
 - Identifying and resolving technical issues related to SAP CO functionality and providing ongoing support to end users.
 
 - Conducting system testing, user training, and documentation of SAP CO implementations and upgrades.
 
 - Write Test cases and undertake testing, collaborate with business for the Acceptance testing

Job Description:
Join Strategy s IT Security group as an Application Security Engineer and play a crucial role in safeguarding Strategy s software applications while using modern security and AI tooling. In this position, you will be responsible for integrating security practices throughout the software development lifecycle, ensuring that our software products are resilient against vulnerabilities.
 
 Secure SDLC Integration:Work closely with development teams to integrate security into the SDLC, including threat modeling, secure code reviews, and security testing.
 Vulnerability Management:Identify, triage, and remediate security vulnerabilities through static and dynamic application security testing (SAST/DAST) and software composition analysis (SCA)tools.
Requirements:
Bachelor s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field
 Minimum 2 years of software development or software security experience in an agile environment
 Hands-on experience with SAST, DAST, IAST, and SCA tools (e.g., Checkmarx, Fortify, Veracode, SonarQube, Burp Suite, ZAP).
 Fluent in one or more programming languages, such as Python, Java, JavaScript
 Strong knowledge of secure coding principles and application security frameworks
 Familiarity with security tools (e.g., static and dynamic analysis tools, vulnerability scanners)
 Understanding of security standards and regulations (e.g., OWASP, NIST)
 Hands-on experience with Generative AI and/or ML in creating innovative applications that enhance productivity and efficiency, coupled with a strong eagerness to learn
Responsibilities:
Hands-on experience with Generative AI and/or ML in creating innovative applications that enhance productivity and efficiency, coupled with a strong eagerness to learn
 Experience with cloud security best practices in AWS, Azure, or GCP.
 Strong work ethic with a commitment to meeting business needs and effectively collaborating with global colleagues
 Effective interpersonal skills; ability to collaborate successfully with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
 Ability to articulate complex technical concepts with clarity, supported by effective written and verbal communication skills
Skills: LAN/WAN design, TCP/IP troubleshooting, network security, routing protocols, firewall mangement, cloud security.

Design and build predictive & forecasting models that drive measurable impact. Plan and run A/B experiments to validate ideas and guide product decisions. Develop and maintain data pipelines that ensure clean, trusted, and timely datasets.
 Lead generative-AI initiatives (e.g., LLM-powered chat, RAG search, custom embeddings).
 Package, deploy, and monitor models using modern MLOps practices in public cloud. Establish monitoring & alerting for accuracy, latency, drift, and cost. Mentor and coach the team, conducting code reviews and sharing best practices.
 Translate complex findings into clear, action-oriented stories for non-technical audiences.
 Ensure data governance and privacy across all projects, meeting internal and industry standards.
 Continuously evaluate new tools & methods, running quick PoCs to keep solutions cutting-edge.
Skills:
Solid foundation in statistics, experiment design, and end-to-end ML workflows.
 Strong Python and SQL; proven record of moving models from notebook to production.
 Hands-on cloud experience (AWS, Azure, or GCP) with container-based deployment and CI/CD.
 Practical exposure to generative-AI projects prompt engineering, fine-tuning, or retrieval-augmented pipelines.

Job Description:
ob Title: Finance Associate (Strategic Growth)
 Company: Hoora Technologies
 Location: Nagpur (In-office)
 Reports to: CEO / Founder
 Experience: 5+ years in Finance Leadership
 Salary & Compensation: 12 - 18 LPA
 Type: Full-Time
 Job Mission
 You will lead the company's financial strategy, operational rigor, and capital allocation. Your mission is to establish a scalable, investment-ready financial foundation and drive decisions that maximize shareholder value, blending operational efficiency with strategic growth planning.
Requirements:
PE Background (Mandatory): You have 5+ years of progressive experience, including a significant tenure as an Investment Analyst, Investment Associate, Principal, or Vice President within a leading Venture Capital or Private Equity firm.
 Fundraising Expertise: Proven expertise in the end-to-end fundraising process, financial due diligence, and building complex valuation models for high-growth tech startups.
 Financial Acumen: Exceptional proficiency in financial modeling, valuation methodologies, and structuring complex debt and equity transactions.
 Startup Operator: Strong operational finance experience, including accounting, compliance, and managing the financial function within a high-growth startup environment.
 Industry Fit: Previous experience in consumer tech, D2C, or hyperlocal services is highly preferred.
 Impact: A track record of driving operational efficiency and providing strategic insights that directly led to profitable revenue growth.
Responsibilities:
Fundraising & Capital Strategy: Lead the preparation for future funding rounds (Seed, Series A). Develop and refine the investor narrative, financial models, and diligence materials. Advise the leadership team on optimal capital structure (debt vs. equity).
 Strategic Financial Planning: Oversee annual budgeting, forecasting, and long-term financial planning. Translate business strategy into actionable financial plans and ensure rigorous ROI analysis across all departments.
 Financial Operations & Compliance: Own the end-to-end finance, accounting, and compliance functions. Ensure timely and accurate reporting, tax compliance (GST, TDS), and maintenance of robust internal controls.
 Growth & Unit Economics: Deeply analyze unit economics (LTV, CAC, Payback) across all verticals (B2C, D2C). Identify opportunities for revenue leakage prevention and profit optimization.
 System & Team Leadership: Implement and automate financial systems (ERP, MIS) to support scale. Lead, mentor, and build a high-performing finance and accounting team.
Skills: accounting compliance, ERP, financial modeling, unit economics, microsoft office.

Job Description: Were looking for a data-science leader who can turn raw data into clear insight and innovative AI products. You ll own projects end-to-end from framing business questions and exploring datasets to deploying and monitoring models in the cloud. Responsibilities:
Design and build predictive & forecasting models that drive measurable impact. Plan and run A/B experiments to validate ideas and guide product decisions. Develop and maintain data pipelines that ensure clean, trusted, and timely datasets.
 Lead generative-AI initiatives (e.g., LLM-powered chat, RAG search, custom embeddings).
 Package, deploy, and monitor models using modern MLOps practices in public cloud. Establish monitoring & alerting for accuracy, latency, drift, and cost. Mentor and coach the team, conducting code reviews and sharing best practices.
 Translate complex findings into clear, action-oriented stories for non-technical audiences.
 Ensure data governance and privacy across all projects, meeting internal and industry standards.
 Continuously evaluate new tools & methods, running quick PoCs to keep solutions cutting-edge.

Solid foundation in statistics, experiment design, and end-to-end ML workflows.
 Strong Python and SQL; proven record of moving models from notebook to production.
 Hands-on cloud experience (AWS, Azure, or GCP) with container-based deployment and CI/CD.
 Practical exposure to generative-AI projects prompt engineering, fine-tuning, or retrieval-augmented pipelines.

Company Description: SAFL is Indias first private sector NBFC focused exclusively on the agricultural sector. Promoted by Jain Irrigation Systems and backed by the International Finance Corporation (IFC), they provide specialized lending for micro-irrigation, farm mechanization, and rural MSMEs. They aim to boost the "Sustainable Agro-Commercial" ecosystem by providing credit where traditional banks often hesitate.
Job Description: As an Assistant Manager at SAFL, you will sit at the intersection of Agri-Business Development and Credit Risk Management. Your role is to evaluate the financial viability of agricultural projectsranging from small-scale irrigation installs to rural business expansions. You aren't just selling a loan; you are conducting deep financial appraisals to ensure that the "Sustainable" part of the company name is met through responsible lending.
Requirements:
Minimum 5 years in finance and accounting (specifically within NBFC Banking).
Strong expertise in Credit Underwriting and Credit Appraisal for rural products.
Knowledge of financial products: LAP (Loan Against Property), MSME loans, and Agri-machinery loans.
Ability to build financial models to forecast the repayment capacity of seasonal agri-businesses.
Excellent communication skills in the local language (Marathi Hindi) to interact with rural clients.
Responsibilities:
Financial Modeling: Develop models to forecast revenue and expenses for agri-projects based on crop cycles and market trends.
Credit Appraisal: Perform rigorous due diligence and credit underwriting for loan applications (Home loans, LAP, Agri-loans).
Budgeting & Planning: Manage the branchs financial planning and ensure resource optimization.
Compliance: Ensure all lending activities adhere to RBI regulations for NBFCs and internal company standards.
Team Leadership: Provide guidance to junior loan officers and relationship managers to improve the quality of the loan portfolio.
Decision Support: Analyze branch data to provide insights that support expansion or risk-mitigation strategies.
Skills: Credit Underwriting, Agri-Finance, NBFC Operations, Credit Appraisal, Budgeting & Forecasting, Financial Modeling, MSME Lending, Loan Against Property (LAP), Risk Management.

Min Education: Bachelor's degree in Finance or Accounting
Company Description: SAFL is a unique private-sector NBFC specifically designed to cater to the agricultural value chain. Promoted by Jain Irrigation Systems and supported by the IFC (World Bank Group), they focus on financing micro-irrigation systems, farm mechanization, and small-scale rural infrastructure. They act as a critical financial bridge for farmers and rural entrepreneurs.
Job Description: As an Executive at SAFL, you will focus on the technical and financial feasibility of agro-commercial loans. This is a "front-to-mid" office role where you transition between sales support and financial analysis. You will be responsible for building the financial case for a loananalyzing the farmer's or business owner's cash flow to ensure the loan is both affordable for the client and safe for the company.
Requirements:
Education: Mandatory Bachelors in Finance or Accounting (B.Com BBA BMS).
Experience: Minimum 2 years in a financial services environment (NBFC experience preferred).
Technical Skills: Proficiency in Financial Modeling and Excel to forecast revenue against agricultural harvest cycles.
Analytical Ability: Strong attention to detail to handle payroll, credit appraisal, and working capital assessments.
Communication: Ability to explain complex financial terms to rural clients and coordinate with cross-functional teams.
Responsibilities:
Project Budgeting: Manage the financial planning for specific sustainable agro-projects in the Amravati cluster.
Financial Analysis: Provide data-backed insights to the Branch Manager to support credit approval or rejection decisions.
Forecasting: Implement models to predict seasonal revenue fluctuations typical in the agri-sector.
Compliance: Ensure all documentation meets NBFC regulatory standards and internal audit requirements.
B2B Liaison: Collaborate with local vendors (like irrigation equipment dealers) to facilitate "Working Capital" and "Business Loans."
Credit Appraisal: Review loan applications for LAP (Loan Against Property), housing loans, and personal loans within the rural context.
Skills: Financial Modeling, Credit Appraisal, Working Capital Management, NBFC Compliance, LAP (Loan Against Property), Micro-Finance, Budgeting, MS Office, Business Communication.

Company Description: Self-described as Indias fastest-growing pharmaceutical company, SCG Healthcare focuses on innovative pharmaceutical solutions. They emphasize a blend of clinical innovation and compassion, aiming to improve global health standards through a wide range of medical products.
Job Description: As a Medical Representative, you act as the vital link between SCG Healthcare and medical professionals. Your primary goal is to increase the prescription volume of the company's medicines by educating doctors and pharmacists. This is a high-energy field role that requires technical pharmaceutical knowledge combined with persuasive communication skills to influence prescribing behavior.
Requirements:

Experience: 12 years in pharma sales (Experience in the Amravati territory is a plus).
Communication: Ability to explain complex drug benefits, contraindications, and side effects clearly.
Analytical Skills: Ability to report on competitor activity and market trends accurately.
Ethics: Strong adherence to healthcare regulations and industry compliance standards.
Responsibilities:
Doctor Detailing: Conduct professional product presentations to healthcare providers to explain drug benefits and clinical advantages.
Relationship Management: Build and maintain long-term rapport with doctors, hospital staff, and pharmacists to ensure consistent product usage.
Target Achievement: Meet and exceed monthly sales and performance metrics set by the Regional Manager.
Market Intelligence: Monitor and report on competitor product launches, pricing strategies, and customer feedback.
Availability Tracking: Coordinate with local chemists and stockists to ensure that the medicines you promote are readily available for patients.
Skills: Pharmaceutical Sales, Product Detailing, Relationship Building, B.Pharma Knowledge, Market Research, Sales Target Achievement, Healthcare Compliance, Negotiation, territory Management.

Job Title: Relationship Executive - GL (Gold Loan) North West
Company Description: Bajaj Finance is one of Indias most diversified and largest NBFCs. It has evolved into a "FinTech" giant, serving over 100 million customers. They are known for their aggressive digital transformation and high standards of corporate governance. The Gold Loan division is a key growth area for the company's North West region.
Job Description: As a Relationship Executive for Gold Loans, your primary mission is to convert walk-in customers and internal branch leads into Gold Loan borrowers. This is a high-speed retail finance role where efficiency is key. You act as the facilitator between the customer, the branch service team, and the Gold Assayer to ensure the loan is disbursed quickly while adhering to strict safety and compliance norms.
Requirements:
Experience: 13 years in sales (Banking or Gold Loan experience is a major advantage).
Product Knowledge: Familiarity with the mechanics of Gold Loans (LTV, interest rates, valuation).
Cross-Selling: Ability to identify opportunities to sell other Bajaj products (Insurance, Fixed Deposits) to Gold Loan clients.
Interpersonal Skills: Strong ability to build trust with customers who are pledging their personal assets.
Responsibilities:
Sales Conversion: Meet monthly disbursement targets by handling customer walk-ins and converting potential leads.
Internal Collaboration: Work with Branch Service Executives to identify "Gold Loan potential" among existing Bajaj customers.
Operational Support: Assist the Gold Assayer with the necessary documentation and KYC processes to ensure a seamless "Service Level Agreement" (SLA) for the customer.
Compliance: Strictly follow company policies regarding gold purity verification and document storage to minimize risk.
SLA Management: Track approval rates and ensure that the time taken from "walk-in to disbursement" is within the company's competitive timelines.
Skills: Gold Loan Sales, Branch Operations, Cross-Selling, Compliance Management, Interpersonal Communication, KYC Documentation, SLA Tracking, Financial Product Sales.

Job Title: Demat Account Opening BDRM (Business Development Relationship Manager)
Company Description: Founded in 2000, Sharekhan is one of India's largest and most trusted full-service retail brokers. Now part of the global financial powerhouse Mirae Asset Group, Sharekhan serves over 30 lakh customers through 130+ branches. Unlike discount brokers, Sharekhan focuses on "Serious Research" and personalized "Relationship Management" to help customers build wealth through Equities, Mutual Funds, and PMS.
Job Description: As a BDRM (Business Development Relationship Manager), your primary goal is Asset Gathering. You are the bridge between the market and the investor. You will identify potential clients in the Amravati region, educate them on the benefits of investing through a full-service broker, and help them open Demat accounts. Once onboarded, you manage their portfolio by suggesting Systematic Investment Plans (SIPs) and various wealth products to increase their "Assets Under Management" (AUM).
Requirements:
Experience: 15 years in BFSI sales (Life Insurance, Mutual Funds, or Broking experience is highly preferred).
Communication: Exceptional interpersonal skills to handle HNI (High Net Worth) acquisitions and client upgrades.
Product Knowledge: Basic understanding of Stock Markets, Mutual Funds, SIPs, and Demat account documentation (KYC).
Motivation: "Go-getter" attitude with a focus on meeting monthly AUM and SIP book targets.
Responsibilities:
Client Acquisition: Open new Demat and Trading accounts by pitching Sharekhan's research-backed investment solutions.
AUM Growth: Gather assets from both new and existing clients to increase the branchs total assigned AUM.
SIP Focused: Build and manage a robust SIP book, encouraging long-term disciplined investing among clients.
Portfolio Management: Suggest suitable investment products (Lump sum, Mutual Funds, PMS) based on the client's risk profile.
Customer Service: Maintain high service standards to ensure client retention and relationship upgrades.
Branch Collaboration: Achieve individual targets that contribute to the overall branch performance in terms of revenue and asset growth.
Skills: Demat Account Opening, SIP Sales, Mutual Fund Sales, AUM Gathering, HNI Client Handling, Relationship Management, Financial Product Pitching, Cross-Selling (Insurance Wealth Products), Lead Conversion.

Company Description: Home First Finance is a technology-driven housing finance company that targets first-time homebuyers in the low and middle-income segments. Established in 2010 and listed on the stock exchange in 2021, HFFC is known for its fast loan processing, transparent dealings, and use of data science to serve customers who may not have traditional income documents.
Job Description: As a Relationship Manager at HFFC, you are the face of the company for aspiring homeowners. This is a high-energy field role where you act as a consultant. You don't just "sell" a loan; you help families navigate the complex journey of buying their first home. You will be responsible for the entire loan lifecyclefrom finding a lead in a local neighborhood to ensuring they pay their monthly installments on time.

Experience: Minimum 2 years in field sales (Banking, NBFC, or Real Estate experience is highly preferred).
Personality: A "street-smart go-getter" who is comfortable working outdoors and interacting with people from diverse income backgrounds.
Analytical Skills: Ability to calculate "surplus income" for customers who may work in the informal sector.
Mobility: Must be willing to travel across Amravati to meet builders, contractors, and potential customers.
Responsibilities:
Business Generation: Conduct local marketing activities (canopies, leafleting, builder meets) to find new home loan seekers.
Customer Profiling: Meet potential customers to understand their household income and suggest the best-suited mortgage product.
End-to-End Fulfillment: Guide the customer through the documentation and application process until the loan is disbursed.
Channel Development: Build and maintain relationships with local property developers, contractors, and real estate agents.
Collection Management: Take responsibility for "Early Mortality" and regular collections to ensure the branch maintains a low NPA (Non-Performing Asset) level.
Skills: Relationship Management, Housing Finance, Direct Sales, Lead Generation, Field Marketing, Debt Collection, Client Relationship Management (CRM), Mortgage Sales, Branch Operations Support.

You will use digital tools (Phone, Email, Video) to connect with customers, explain financial products, and close leads provided by the bank's database.

Relationship Management: Ability to manage "Tie-up partners" (bank staff) to ensure a smooth flow of leads.

Lead Conversion: Take ownership of pre-qualified leads provided by the company and close them through virtual consultations.
Branch Operations: Oversee the overall sales operations for the assigned branch digitally.
Cross-Selling: Analyze the customer's existing profile and cross-sell relevant products like Credit Cards, Loans, or Insurance riders.
Partner Management: Work closely with the bank's staff to ensure lead generation targets are met.

Company Name: Axis Max Life Insurance (Joint Venture between Max Financial Services & Axis Bank)
Company Description: Max Life Insurance is a leading private life insurer in India, known for its customer-centric approach and high claim settlement ratio. The company operates through a multi-channel distribution network. It is consistently recognized as a "Great Place to Work," emphasizing a supportive environment for its human capital.
Job Description: As an Associate Agency Development Manager, you are essentially a Business Partner and Coach. Your success is tied to the success of the agents (advisors) you recruit. Unlike direct sales, this role requires you to build a sustainable "sales engine" by identifying individuals who want to become insurance advisors, training them, and helping them close their first few deals. You act as the bridge between company targets and the agent's earning potential.

Company Description: Drishtee is a prominent social organization focused on rural empowerment. They act as a bridge between banks and rural communities through the Business Correspondent (BC) model. Job Description: As a Cluster Manager, you are responsible for the operational success and profitability of a group of Customer Service Points (CSPs) or "Bank Mitras." This is a high-responsibility role where you perform Concurrent Audits (real-time checking) and Pre-payment Audits. Your job is to ensure that every rupee spent on procurement, coal, or labor follows company SOPs and statutory laws. You will move beyond the desk to physically verify bulk materials like coal and ash.

Experience: Preference for those from Manufacturing or Infrastructure backgrounds (Power sector experience is a huge plus).

Operational Audits: Independently audit diverse departments including Procurement, HR (recruitment files), Stores, and Security.
Material Verification: Conduct physical reconciliation of high-value bulk materials such as Coal, Diesel, and Spare Parts.

Special Investigations: Lead whistleblower reviews or specific management-directed investigations.

Company Description: Plasti Surge Industries Pvt. Ltd. (PSI), established in 1989, is a pioneer in the healthcare consumables industry in India. Based in Amravati, the company is a trusted manufacturer of medical disposables, diagnostic kits, and healthcare solutions. They are currently expanding their innovation wing to move beyond basic disposables into high-tech rapid testing kits for water, soil, food, and medical diagnostics.
Job Description: This is an Innovation and Applied Research role. You will not just be managing a production line; you will be designing the "chemistry" behind rapid testing kits. The goal is to create easy-to-use tools (like strips, tablets, or vials) that can detect impurities in water or soil without needing a full laboratory. You will report directly to the Head of Innovation.
Responsibilities:
New Product Development: Design chemistry-based kits for environmental monitoring (e.g., detecting pesticides in food, heavy metals in water, or soil health).
Iterative Optimization: Improve existing digital multi-parameter water analyzers and colorimetric kits through prototype testing.
Validation & Compliance: Perform stability studies and sensitivity testing according to BIS, ISO, and NABL standards to ensure the kits work accurately in the field.
Technology Scouting: Research new reagents and enzymatic indicators to simplify testing methods for non-experts.
Documentation: Maintain detailed lab notebooks using Design of Experiments (DoE) and prepare technical dossiers for regulatory approval.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work with the electronics team to integrate chemical sensors into digital diagnostic hardware.
Skills:
Wet Chemistry: Mastery of titration, pH monitoring, and colorimetric indicators.

Instrumentation: Hands-on experience with Spectrophotometry and Chromatography.

Formulation: Ability to develop chemical reagents in stable tablet, strip, or liquid forms.

Quality Standards: Knowledge of GMP (Good Manufacturing Practices) and GLP (Good Laboratory Practices).

Company Description: Achievers Spot is an ISO-certified organization specializing in Medical Coding training and placement. Job Description: Medical Coding is the "translation" of healthcare. When a doctor treats a patient, they write notes. A Medical Coder takes those notes and converts them into standardized alphanumeric codes. These codes are then used by insurance companies to process claims and by hospitals to maintain records.
Responsibilities:
Code Conversion: Use ICD-10 CM (for Diagnoses) and CPT (for Procedures) code books to transform text-based medical reports into numeric alphanumeric codes.
Chart Review: Analyze patient medical records, including lab results and physician notes, to ensure all services provided are captured accurately.
Compliance: Follow strict healthcare regulations (HIPAA) to protect patient privacy and ensure billing accuracy.
Collaboration: Coordinate with healthcare providers to clarify any missing or ambiguous information in the medical charts.
Skills:
Education: B.Pharm, M.Pharm, D.Pharm, Nursing, Physiotherapy, or any Life Science degree (Zoology, Botany, Microbiology, etc.).

Core Knowledge: Strong understanding of Human Anatomy and Physiology is essential.

Technical: Basic computer literacy and good communication skills to work in a corporate BPO environment.

Min Education: Any Graduate (Social Work Education backgrounds preferred)

Company Description: Code Orion is a technology firm involved in game development and IT services. While the job is listed under "Head - QA," the responsibilities clearly define a Project Management and Production role within the iGaming (Slot Games) sector. This suggests the company is building a specialized team in Amravati to cater to the global digital casino and gaming market.
Job Description: As a Slot Game Producer, you act as the Project Manager for the entire game creation process. You are the "conductor of the orchestra," ensuring that artists, developers, and sound designers work in sync. Your goal is to take a game from a mathematical concept theme to a polished product that is bug-free and compliant with international gambling regulations.
Requirements:
Technical Foundation: B.Tech B.E. degree is mandatory. Understanding of Unity3D and C# is a major advantage even if you aren't coding.
Project Management: Skills in production scheduling, risk management, and project budgeting.
Analytical Mindset: Ability to understand game mathematics (volatility, RTP - Return to Player) and market trends.
Soft Skills: Strong problem-solving and the ability to resolve "bottlenecks" between creative and technical teams.
Responsibilities:
Lifecycle Management: Oversee the "A to Z" of slot game creationfrom the initial theme selection and math model to final deployment.
Team Coordination: Act as the central hub for communication between Unity C# developers, 2D 3D artists, sound engineers, and Quality Assurance (QA).
Schedules & Milestones: Develop production timelines (Gantt charts) and ensure the team meets deadlines for "sprints."
Compliance & Quality: Ensure the "RNG" (Random Number Generator) and game mechanics meet the regulatory standards of the markets the game will be released in.
Budgeting: Monitor resources and costs to ensure the project remains profitable.
Data Analysis: Post-launch, look at player "retention" and "spend" data to decide what features to add in the next update.
Skills: Production Scheduling, Slot Game Development, Unity3D, Project Execution, Quality Management, Game Math, Milestone Tracking.

They are currently expanding their specialized iGaming division in Amravati, focusing on the production of digital slot games for the global market. The company emphasizes a collaborative environment where artists, designers, and developers work together to create high-engagement gaming experiences.
Job Description: As a 2D Spine Animator, your primary tool is Esoteric Softwares Spine. Unlike traditional frame-by-frame animation, you will use "Skeletal Animation" to give life to characters, symbols, and UI elements. In the world of slot games, animations need to be "juicy"meaning they must feel rewarding, smooth, and visually exciting to keep the player engaged during wins and bonus rounds.
Requirements:
Primary Tool: Expert-level knowledge of Spine 2D.
Design Tools: Proficiency in Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator for asset preparation.
Motion Graphics: Familiarity with After Effects for creating particle effects or promotional trailers.
Technical Knowledge: Understanding of "Draw Calls" and texture packing to optimize game performance.
Artistic Sense: Strong grasp of the 12 principles of animation, especially squash and stretch, timing, and appeal.
Responsibilities:
Skeletal Animation: Rig and animate 2D characters and game assets (symbols, backgrounds, and pop-ups) using Spine.
Engagement Design: Create "Win Animations" and "Anticipation Loops" that heighten the excitement of the gambling experience.
Asset Preparation: Work with layered PSD or AI files from artists to ensure they are correctly sliced and prepared for rigging.

Kiln Operation: Continuously monitor and control kiln parameters (temperature, pressure, feed rate) to achieve production targets while identifying and correcting abnormalities.
Pollution Control: Manage Electrostatic Precipitators (ESP) and other systems to ensure zero trippings and strict adherence to BIS environmental norms.
Shutdown Management: Lead the inspection and repair of equipment (Preheater, Kiln, Decoloriser) during planned shutdowns to ensure high mechanical availability.
Quality & Safety: Implement Kaizen, 5S, and "Why-Why Analysis" to eliminate waste (Muda) and maintain a safe, leak-free working environment.
Documentation: Maintain accurate logbooks for operational parameters and shift-wise production reports for senior management.
Skills: Pyro-processing, Kiln Operations, Chemical Engineering, WCM (World Class Manufacturing), Kaizen, 5S, Pollution Control (ESP), ISO EMS Standards, Information Security (ISMS), Shutdown Planning, Process Optimization.

Company Description: TAG is a major education provider operating across the Middle East and Africa. They partner with top global universities (like Curtin University and Lancaster University) to manage their branch campuses. This specific role focuses on Curtin University Dubai, ensuring the institution meets the strict data standards of UAE government regulators.
Job Description: This is a High-Compliance Technical role. You are not just analyzing data; you are building the "plumbing" (ETL pipelines) that moves data from student systems, HR, and finance into official government reports. The UAE education sector is strictly regulated by bodies like the CAA and KHDA. If the data you provide is inaccurate, the university could face licensing issues. You will be responsible for ensuring that "Institutional KPIs" (like student retention and graduate success) are calculated perfectly and reported on time.
Requirements:
SQL Mastery: Advanced proficiency in SQL and relational databases is mandatory.
ETL Expertise: Proven experience building data pipelines and integration frameworks.
Analytical Tools: Advanced MS Excel and experience with Power BI or Tableau.
Process Driven: Experience in data cleaning, validation, and creating "reproducible" processes (scripts that can run again without manual work).
Domain Knowledge (Desirable): Familiarity with the UAE's CAA KHDA reporting or the general student lifecycle.
Responsibilities:
Design and maintain ETL processes to integrate data from LMS (Learning Management Systems), HR, and Finance.
Align data models with specific government KPIs (MOHESR, HEDB, KHDA
Maintain a Regulatory Reporting Calendar to ensure zero missed deadlines
Build dashboards to monitor Retention, Progression, and Completion rates.
Act as a "Data Steward," ensuring data definitions are consistent across the whole university.
Present risk metrics and compliance status to Senior Leadership and Boards.
Skills: ETL Development, SQL, Data Pipelines, Power BI Tableau, Data Governance, Regulatory Compliance (CAA KHDA), Data Validation, Institutional Research, MS Excel (Advanced), Data Modeling.

Client Support: Assist senior analysts in creating polished presentations for business stakeholders.
Quality Control: Double-check all numbers to ensure data integrity and confidentiality.
Skills: Data Analysis, SQL, Python, Power BI, Tableau, Microsoft Excel, Business Intelligence, Data Cleaning, Statistical Interpretation, Report Preparation.

Interview Type: Technical SQL Assessment -> Python Pandas Live Coding -> Stakeholder Presentation Round
Company Description: Founded in 2018, Digital Solution Tech is an IT consulting and automation firm. They are known for building complex business automation systems and delivering end-to-end digital transformation projects. The company operates at the intersection of web technology and heavy data processing, providing insights for diverse industry verticals.
Job Description: In this role, you will be the bridge between raw data and business strategy. You are responsible for handling large, complex datasets that require sophisticated processing. Beyond standard visualization, you will be expected to use Python for statistical analysis and collaborate with engineering teams to ensure the underlying data models are scalable and accurate.
Requirements:
Technical Mastery: 4+ years of hands-on experience with SQL and Python (Pandas, NumPy).
Visualization Expert: Advanced skills in Tableau or Power BI to build interactive, optimized dashboards.
Statistical Depth: Ability to perform deep-dive statistical analysis to uncover non-obvious patterns.
ML Awareness: Familiarity with basic Machine Learning concepts to help evaluate early-stage models.
Collaboration: Strong communication skills to present complex technical findings to non-technical business leaders.
Responsibilities:

Dashboard Optimization: Build and maintain high-performance reports that load efficiently.
Data Engineering Collaboration: Participate in data modeling and performance analytics discussions.
Python Processing: Use Pandas and NumPy for high-speed data transformation and validation.
Stakeholder Management: Present structured findings and data-driven recommendations to cross-functional teams.
Process Improvement: Develop best practices and frameworks for the company's internal data workflows.
Skills: Data Analysis, SQL (Advanced), Python, Pandas, NumPy, Tableau, Power BI, Data Modeling, Statistical Analysis, Machine Learning (Basics), Stakeholder Presentation.

Company Description: Founded in 2018, Digital Solution Tech is an IT consulting and automation firm. The company operates at the intersection of web technology and heavy data processing, providing insights for diverse industry verticals.
Job Description: You are the Power BI Architect for the organization. Your role is to bridge the gap between complex raw data and high-level business strategy. You will spend less time cleaning data and more time partnering with CEOs and Directors to define what "success" looks like, then building the interactive dashboards that track it.

Job Title: MD General Medicine Internal Medicine Physician
Company Description:
Company Name: HCDS Consultant Private Limited (Recruitment Partner)
Industry: Medical Services Healthcare
Contact Details: 8121241717 | radhikabadigar.hcds@gmail.com
Hospital Profile: A reputed multispecialty hospital based in Nagpur, offering a collaborative environment with high growth prospects for early-career physicians.
Job Description: As an MD General Medicine professional, you will function as the primary diagnostic and non-surgical specialist for adult patients. Your role is central to the hospital's internal medicine department, where you will manage a broad spectrum of illnessesfrom acute infections and metabolic disorders to chronic conditions like hypertension and diabetes. You will be expected to make critical clinical decisions and coordinate with super-specialists for comprehensive patient care.
Requirements:
Education: MD or DNB in General Medicine Internal Medicine is mandatory.
Experience: 13 years of post-qualification experience in a hospital setting.
Clinical Proficiency: Expertise in diagnosing complex systemic diseases and managing inpatient (IPD) care.
Team Skills: Ability to collaborate with a multidisciplinary team of consultants, nursing staff, and technicians.
Responsibilities:
Patient Management: Assessing and treating patients in the Outpatient Department (OPD) and ensuring high-quality inpatient care.
Ward Rounds: Leading daily clinical rounds to monitor patient recovery, adjust medications, and plan discharges.
Consultations: Providing expert medical opinions for surgical or other specialty departments when systemic complications arise.
Clinical Governance: Maintaining detailed medical records, ensuring protocols for patient safety are followed.
Emergency Support: Stabilizing patients in acute distress and coordinating with the ICU team.
Skills: General Medicine, Internal Medicine, Clinical Diagnosis, Inpatient Care Management, Ward Management, Patient Counseling, DNB MD Clinical Standards, Differential Diagnosis.

Min Education: M.Sc in Chemistry (B.Sc in Microbiology Chemistry Env. Science also considered)
Company Description: This role is for a leading testing laboratory or manufacturing unit located in the Butibori industrial area. The company specializes in environmental and food safety testing, adhering to NABL standards to ensure quality compliance for water, soil, and food products.
Job Description: As a QC Chemist, you are responsible for ensuring that raw materials, in-process samples, and finished products meet strict safety and quality specifications. Your work is highly technical and data-driven, involving the chemical analysis of water, food, and soil samples. You will operate high-end analytical instruments to detect contaminants, nutrient levels, and chemical compositions, ensuring all results are documented for regulatory audits (like NABL).
Requirements:
Education: Post-graduation (M.Sc) in Chemistry is mandatory.
Experience: 12 years in a lab setting specifically focused on Water, Food, or Soil testing.
Technical Skills: Hands-on experience with GC (Gas Chromatography) and HPLC (High-Performance Liquid Chromatography).
Regulatory Knowledge: Familiarity with NABL guidelines and microbiological analysis.
Responsibilities:
Sample Analysis: Performing routine chemical testing on water (potable wastewater), food products, and soil samples.
Instrument Operation: Calibrating and operating sophisticated instruments like HPLC, GC, and Spectrophotometers.
Microbiological Testing: Conducting analysis for food microbiology and environmental science parameters.
Standardization: Preparing standard solutions and reagents required for various analytical methods.
Documentation: Maintaining precise laboratory notebooks and generating COA (Certificate of Analysis) reports.
Compliance: Ensuring the laboratory environment meets safety and cleanliness protocols.
Skills: Analytical Chemistry, HPLC GC Operation, Water Quality Testing, Soil Analysis, NABL Documentation, Spectrophotometry, Food Technology, Laboratory Safety, Titration, Microbiological Analysis.

Min Education: Diploma (Mechanical Electrical E&TC) or Bachelor's Degree (BA B.Com B.Sc)
Company Name: Jaya Hind Industries Ltd. (A Force Motors Group Company)
Company Description: Jaya Hind Industries is one of India's largest and most technologically advanced Aluminium Die Casting companies. As part of the Force Motors Group, they manufacture critical automotive components like engine blocks, cylinder heads, and transmission housings for global automotive giants.
Job Description: As a Fresher On-Roll Trainee, you will be part of a high-tech manufacturing environment. Depending on your qualification, you will be placed in the Production, Quality, or Maintenance departments. You will work with automated machinery and follow standardized manufacturing processes to produce precision automotive parts.
Requirements:
Technical candidates must understand basic engineering drawings and safety protocols.
Non-technical graduates (BA B.Com B.Sc) will assist in production line management and documentation.
Strong discipline and willingness to work in a shop-floor environment.
Physical fitness for standing shifts in a factory setting.
Responsibilities:
Production Line: Operating specialized casting or assembly machinery under supervision.
Quality Check: Visually inspecting finished parts for defects (blowholes, cracks) and ensuring they meet design specs.
Process Adherence: Following Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and maintaining 5S (Sort, Set in order, Shine, Standardize, Sustain) at the workstation.
Maintenance Assistance: (For Diploma holders) Assisting senior engineers in preventive maintenance of electrical or mechanical systems.
Safety Compliance: Wearing mandatory PPE (Safety shoes, helmet, gloves) and reporting any unsafe conditions.
Skills: Production Line Operations, Basic Electrical Mechanical knowledge, 5S Standards, Quality Inspection, Communication Skills, Automobile Component Manufacturing, Industrial Safety.

Min Education: B.E. B.Tech in Metallurgy, Mechanical, or Production Industrial Engineering
Company Name: Authentic Staffing Agency (on behalf of a manufacturing client)
Company Description: Authentic Staffing Agency is a workforce solutions provider that manages project recruitment, compliance, and HR strategies for industrial partners across India and the US.
Job Description: As the Production Manager for Galvanization, you are the technical and operational head of the Hot-Dip Galvanizing (HDG) plant. Your primary goal is to ensure that steel components are coated with zinc efficiently, safely, and to the highest quality standards. You will manage the entire lifecycle of the processfrom surface preparation (pickling) to the final quenching and inspectionwhile strictly controlling the consumption of Zinc, which is the most expensive variable in the process.
Requirements:
Education: Degree in Metallurgy or Mechanical Engineering is essential to understand material properties and furnace mechanics.
Experience: Extensive experience in Hot-Dip Galvanizing is mandatory.
Technical Knowledge: Deep understanding of bath chemistry, fluxing, and temperature control of the zinc kettle.
Standards: Familiarity with IS ASTM EN standards for coating thickness and quality.
Responsibilities:
Process Oversight: Managing the zinc kettle operations, pretreatment tanks (acid pickling), and drying quenching phases.
Cost Control: Monitoring and optimizing "Zinc Consumption" and "Yield." Your success depends on reducing process losses and rework.
Quality Assurance: Ensuring all products meet customer specifications through rigorous testing and documentation (ISO standards).
Maintenance Coordination: Planning preventive maintenance for critical assets like overhead cranes, furnaces, and material handling systems.
EHS Compliance: Driving a "Zero-Accident" culture by ensuring strict PPE usage, proper fume extraction, and safe handling of waste acids effluents.
Reporting: Analyzing KPIs like OEE (Overall Equipment Effectiveness), energy consumption, and productivity for senior management.
Skills: Hot-Dip Galvanizing, Metallurgy, Zinc Kettle Management, 5S & Kaizen, Production Planning, OEE Tracking, EHS Compliance, Waste Acid Management, Manpower Scheduling, Cost Optimization, Quality Systems (ISO).

Min Education: B.E. B.Tech in Civil Engineering (Master's preferred)
Company Description: Kyansh Construction is a high-growth infrastructure firm specializing in public sector projects. They focus on large-scale civil works across Maharashtra, including roadways, bridges, and water management systems (barrages).
Job Description: As the Deputy Project Manager, you will be the technical lead for massive infrastructure developments in the Vidarbha region. Your role is highly specialized, moving beyond general building construction into heavy civil engineering (roads, bridges, and barrages). You will be responsible for the "Triple Constraint" of project management: delivering the project On Time, Within Budget, and To Quality Specifications set by government bodies like NHAI or PWD.
Requirements:
Education: B.Tech B.E. in Civil Engineering is mandatory; an M.Tech in Construction Management is an advantage.
Sector Expertise: Experience working on Government Projects (NHAI PWD Irrigation) is highly preferred.
Technical Knowledge: Understanding of bridge engineering, pavement design, and hydraulic structures (barrages).
Leadership: Ability to handle multiple work sites and coordinate between sub-contractors and government officials.
Responsibilities:
Project Execution: Leading the end-to-end execution of roads, bridges, and barrages.
Sub-contractor Management: Evaluating and supervising sub-contractors to ensure they meet project milestones.
Material Planning: Managing the procurement of bulk materials (cement, steel, bitumen, aggregates) to prevent site downtime.
Compliance & Quality: Ensuring all works meet the strict technical standards of MoRTH NHAI and handling project approvals.
Reporting: Preparing Daily Weekly Progress Reports (DPR WPR) and presenting them to the Managing Director and Client Representatives.
Tender Review: Reviewing tender documents and technical specifications to ensure alignment during the execution phase.
Skills: Infrastructure Project Management, Civil Construction (Roads Bridges Barrages), Site Management, Material Procurement, Government Liaison, Tender Documentation, Quality Compliance, Construction Scheduling.

Min Education: B.E. B.Tech or Diploma in Civil Engineering
Company Description: Kyansh Construction is a specialized firm focusing on public sector infrastructure. They operate across the Vidarbha region and Pune, executing critical civil engineering projects that require strict adherence to government technical specifications.
Job Description: As a Civil Engineer, you will bridge the gap between architectural drawings and on-ground reality. Your role involves "Quantity Surveying" (calculating exactly how much material is needed) and "Billing" (verifying that subcontractors are paid accurately for the work done). You will also use AutoCAD to make on-site adjustments to designs.
Responsibilities:
Quantity Estimation: Calculating material quantities (concrete, steel, bitumen) from structural drawings.
Billing & Scrutiny: Verifying subcontractor invoices against actual work measurements (MB - Measurement Book).
AutoCAD: Modifying and updating site drawings as per physical conditions.
Reporting: Assisting in the preparation of Daily Progress Reports (DPR). Laboratory Testing: Conducting sieve analysis for aggregates, cement consistency tests, and compressive strength tests (Cube Tests).
Field Testing: Performing Soil Compaction tests (Core cutter Sand replacement) and Bitumen temperature checks.
Documentation: Maintaining the Quality Assurance (QA) registers and Pour Cards for every structural element.
Compliance: Ensuring all workmanship follows the relevant IS Codes (Indian Standards).
Skills:
Civil Engineering: Site Supervision, Measurements, RCC Works.

Quality Control: IS Codes (IS 456, IS 2720), Mix Design, Lab Testing.

Software: AutoCAD, MS Excel (Advanced), MS Office.

Project Types: Highways (Bituminous PQC), Bridges (Girders Piers), Irrigation (Canals Barrages).

Min Education: B.E. B.Tech in Civil Engineering (Masters in Structural Engineering preferred)
Company Description: Kyansh Construction handles large-scale government infrastructure tenders. They are currently focusing on the Vidarbha region for the construction of water-retaining structures (barrages) and high-load transport infrastructure (bridges).
Job Description: In this role, you focus on Hydraulic Structures. Unlike standard buildings, barrages must withstand massive hydrostatic and uplift pressures. You will ensure the structural integrity of spillways, piers, and gates. Your role bridges the gap between the design consultants software models and the physical reality of the riverbed.
Responsibilities:
Structural Analysis: Analyzing spillways and hydraulic structures for safety against scouring and uplift.
Drawing Review: Scrutinizing reinforcement detailing to prevent thermal cracking in mass concrete.
Technical Support: Providing on-site guidance during complex foundation and concreting operations.
BOQ Verification: Ensuring the Bill of Quantities aligns with the structural design to avoid cost overruns.Execution Supervision: Managing the construction of piles, piers, and the launching of girders.
BBS Preparation: Creating and verifying Bar Bending Schedules (BBS) to minimize steel wastage.
Standards Compliance: Ensuring all work meets IRC and MoRTH specifications for bridge longevity.
Coordination: Working with QC teams to ensure the concrete grade and pre-stressing tension are exact.
Skills:
Design Tools: STAAD Pro, AutoCAD, and relevant bridge design software.

Technical Standards: IRC (Indian Roads Congress), IS Codes (Concrete & Steel), MoRTH Specifications.

Specialized Knowledge: Hydraulic Design, Mass Concreting, Reinforcement Detailing, Pre-stressing (Post-tensioning Pre-tensioning).

Company Description: Voyants Solutions is a premier multidisciplinary consulting firm. They act as Project Management Consultants (PMC) for large-scale government and private infrastructure projects. Their role is to represent the client (e.g., NHAI, PWD) to ensure that the contractor executes the project exactly according to the approved design and quality standards.
Job Description: As the Resident Engineer (Bridges), you are the senior-most technical authority on-site for bridge structures. Working for a PMC means you are the "Watchdog." You don't just execute; you verify. You will oversee the contractors work, approve shop drawings, monitor the casting and launching of PSC Girders, and ensure that the bridge geometryespecially for spans over difficult terrain or railwaysis mathematically perfect.
Requirements:
Technical Depth: Expert knowledge in bridge structural analysis, specifically for Steel and Concrete designs.
Supervision Background: Experience with a Project Management Consultant (PMC) or a major Construction Agency is mandatory.
Management Skills: Ability to manage all site resources, including manpower and machinery (like launching girders).
Certifications: Proficiency in load ratings and bridge inspection protocols.
Responsibilities:
Design Verification: Performing and checking bridge geometry and complex quantity calculations.
Document Control: Developing and reviewing contract specifications, cost estimates, and shop drawings.
Inspection & Rating: Conducting detailed bridge inspections and performing load ratings to ensure structural safety.
Contract Management: Reviewing construction documents and managing "Requests for Information" (RFIs) from the contractor.
Execution Oversight: Supervising the specialized process of Pre-stressing (tensioning) and the erection of steel concrete girders.
Skills: Bridge Structural Analysis, PSC Girder Erection, Steel Structure Design, Bridge Geometry, Cost Estimation, Load Rating, Project Management, Quality Supervision, Contract Documentation.

Min Education: B.Arch (M.Arch in Heritage Conservation is desirable for the Conservation role)
Company Description: Kabira Architecture specializes in the niche field of Heritage Conservation and the development of Tourist Infrastructure. They work on preserving historic structures while creating modern facilities for tourism, making them a unique player in the Indian architectural landscape.
Job Description: As an Architect or Conservation Architect, you will work on projects that balance history with functionality. For the Wardha location (which is rich in Gandhian heritage), your role will involve sensitive design development that respects existing architectural fabric. You will transition from "documentation" (measuring and drawing old buildings) to "design development" (creating new interventions) and "site supervision" (ensuring the contractor uses correct traditional or modern materials).
Requirements:
Technical Proficiency: Mastery of AutoCAD for 2D drafting and 3D software (like Revit, SketchUp, or Rhino) for visualization.
Documentation Skills: Ability to perform detailed heritage mapping and condition assessments.
Desirable Experience: Experience in creating Bill of Quantities (BoQ) and technical Working Drawings.
Niche Interest: Preference for candidates who have worked on heritage sites or government-led tourism projects.
Responsibilities:
Heritage Documentation: Conducting detailed surveys and creating "as-built" drawings of historic structures.
Design Development: Creating architectural solutions for tourist amenities (cafes, pathways, lighting, interpretation centers).
Project Coordination: Liaising between consultants, government bodies, and site teams.
Site Supervision: Ensuring construction follows the specific Conservation Management Plan (CMP).
Documentation & Mapping: Creating thematic maps for heritage circuits.
Skills: Heritage Conservation, AutoCAD, 3D Modeling, Site Supervision, Heritage Mapping, BoQ Preparation, Working Drawings, Tourism Infrastructure Design, Historic Preservation.

Min Education: Any Graduate (Bachelors in Agriculture or Supply Chain is beneficial)
Company Description: Yashoda Hybrid Seeds is a prominent player in the agricultural sector, specializing in the research, production, and marketing of high-quality hybrid seeds. Based in Wardha, they manage a large-scale supply chain that distributes seeds to farmers and distributors across various regions.
Job Description: As a Dispatch Executive, you are the final link in the supply chain. Your role is to ensure that the right seeds reach the right customer at the right time. In the seed industry, this is highly seasonal and time-sensitive. You will manage the movement of goods from the warehouse to the transport vehicle, ensuring that all biological certifications and commercial invoices are perfectly accurate to avoid delays at checkpoints or with customers.
Requirements:
Experience: 15 years in logistics or dispatch.
Industry Knowledge: Familiarity with seed varieties is a major advantage (e.g., Cotton, Soyabean, Maize).
Technical Skills: Proficiency in order processing software and MS Excel for reporting.
Accuracy: High attention to detail, as seed quantities and variety names must be exact to prevent legal or quality disputes.
Responsibilities:
Order Processing: Reviewing incoming orders, verifying seed types, and checking delivery addresses.
Internal Coordination: Working with Production (to check stock availability) and Packaging (to ensure bags are ready for load).
Documentation: Generating critical paperwork including Invoices, Packing Lists, and Waybills.
Logistics Scheduling: Coordinating with transporters and truck drivers to ensure vehicles are available for the day's dispatch schedule.
QA Liaison: Working with Quality Assurance to ensure that only tested and certified seeds are loaded.
Customer Interaction: Providing order updates and delivery timelines to distributors or retail partners.
Skills: Order Processing, Inventory Coordination, Logistics Management, Dispatch Documentation, SCM (Supply Chain Management), Customer Communication, Warehouse Reporting, Microsoft Office.

Company Description:
Company Name: Pollinate Group (Pollinate Energy Ltd)
Industry: NGO Social Enterprises Renewable Energy
Mission: Pollinate Group is a global social business that empowers women in marginalized communities to become entrepreneurs (called "Suryamukhis"). They distribute life-improving products like solar lights and clean cookstoves to families living in poverty.
Global Presence: Operates in India and Nepal with international collaborations.
Job Description: As an Entrepreneurship Development Officer (EDO), you are a mentor, trainer, and sales strategist for a network of women entrepreneurs. You act as the bridge between the NGO and the "Suryamukhis"women from underprivileged backgrounds who sell clean energy products. This is a "boots-on-the-ground" role where you spend most of your time in communities, not behind a desk. You are responsible for identifying, training, and supporting these women to ensure their businesses are profitable and impactful.
Requirements:
Passion: Deep interest in social impact, renewable energy, and gender equality.
Resilience: Willingness to work in challenging environments (slums rural areas) and move without constant supervision.
Communication: Proficiency in local languages to build trust with community members.
Tech Savvy: Basic ability to use CRM tools and Microsoft Office for reporting.
Responsibilities:
Recruitment & Training: Identifying potential women entrepreneurs and conducting classroom and field-based training in sales, finance, and digital tools.
Sales Management: Helping Suryamukhis manage their "Sales Funnel"finding new customers, following up on leads, and forecasting monthly sales.
Performance Reviews: Analyzing which entrepreneurs are struggling and providing "refresher training" to prevent them from dropping out.
Community Engagement: Organizing "Mobile Hives" (roadshows) and educational events to raise awareness about solar and clean energy products.
Reporting: Updating daily and monthly sales reports and tracking the competency levels of your entrepreneurs every quarter.
Financial Oversight: Managing order fulfillment and following up on payments from the field.
Skills: Training & Development, Community Mobilization, B2C Sales, Women Empowerment, CRM Management, Lead Generation, Public Speaking (Roadshows), MS Office, Relationship Management.

Company Name: Bada Business Pvt. Ltd. (Represented by Global Act)
Company Description: Bada Business is a platform providing entrepreneurship education and leadership development training to small and medium enterprises (MSMEs). Founded by world-renowned business coach Dr. Vivek Bindra, the company aims to help Indian entrepreneurs scale their businesses through specialized digital courses and live events.
Job Description: As a Business Counselor, you are more than a salespersonyou are a diagnostic advisor. Your job is to talk to small business owners and aspiring entrepreneurs, listen to their "burning problems" (such as low sales, cash flow issues, or team management troubles), and recommend the right educational products from the Bada Business ecosystem to solve those problems. You act as the bridge between the client's current business challenges and their future growth.
Requirements:
Experience: 1 to 4 years in sales, tele-calling, or counseling.
Communication: Exceptional verbal communication and active listening skills are mandatory.
Mindset: You must be passionate about business development and have the "convincing power" to handle objections.
Tech Skills: Basic proficiency in using CRM (Customer Relationship Management) software to track leads.
Responsibilities:
Consultative Sales: Engaging with leads (inbound and outbound) to understand their specific business needs and tailoring solutions.
Client Relationship: Acting as a "Trusted Advisor" rather than a pushy salesperson to build long-term rapport.
Query Management: Responding to sales queries promptly via phone, email, or in-person meetings.
Target Achievement: Meeting monthly sales targets by converting leads into enrollments for business programs.
Market Intelligence: Keeping track of what competitors are offering and staying updated on Bada Business product launches.
Feedback Loop: Regularly seeking client feedback to improve service delivery and identifying opportunities for upselling or cross-selling.
Skills: Consultative Selling, Business Development, Presentation Skills, Relationship Management, CRM Usage, Convincing Power, Problem Solving, Marketing Knowledge, Management Skills.

Min Education: Any Graduate (BBA MBA in Marketing is an advantage)
Company Description: Global Education Ltd. is an expert consultancy firm headquartered in Mumbai with a major branch in Nagpur. They provide a wide range of services to educational institutions and students, including infrastructure development, training, and recruitment services.
Job Description: As a Marketing Executive, your goal is to bridge the gap between educational services and the target audience (students, parents, or institutions). You will be responsible for "Integrated Marketing," which means ensuring a consistent brand message across offline events, print media, and digital platforms. This is a high-energy role that requires you to move from planning at a desk to organizing large-scale seminars and exhibitions in the field.
Requirements:
Education: A Bachelors degree in any field (Marketing or Business preferred).
Communication: Strong writing and proofreading skills for brochures, adverts, and online campaigns.
Versatility: Ability to handle diverse tasks ranging from data management to photo shoot organization.
Relationship Management: Skilled at networking to secure sponsorships and build long-term customer relationships.
Responsibilities:
Campaign Development: Helping design and execute marketing plans and direct marketing campaigns.
Event Management: Organizing and attending conferences, seminars, and exhibitions to promote educational services.
Content Creation: Writing copy for marketing materials and working with creative agencies for design.
Market Research: Conducting focus groups and questionnaires to understand customer needs.
Public Relations: Managing the brand image and sourcing advertising opportunities in the press.
Operations: Maintaining customer databases and ensuring the effective distribution of printed marketing materials.
Skills: Integrated Marketing, Event Management, Market Research, Public Relations, Copywriting, Direct Marketing, Sponsorship Acquisition, Advertising Strategy, Customer Relationship Management (CRM).

Company Description: The Commercial Banking Group (CBG) at Axis Bank focuses on the SME (Small and Medium Enterprise) segment. They provide specialized financial solutions like working capital, term loans, and trade finance to businesses. Axis Bank is one of India's largest private sector banks, known for its digital-first approach (Project Neo, Siddhi).
Job Description: As a Relationship Manager (RM), you are the face of Axis Bank for business clients. Your primary goal is to grow the bank's "Lending Book." This means finding new businesses that need loans (NTB - New to Bank) and increasing the business from current clients (ETB - Existing to Bank). You act as a consultant, helping businesses manage their cash flow through credit facilities while ensuring the banks money is safe (Risk Management).
Requirements:
Experience: Minimum 2 years in Sales, specifically in SME SBB Banking or Lending products.
Product Knowledge: Strong understanding of Working Capital (CC OD), Term Loans, and Trade Finance.
Tech Savvy: Ability to use digital banking platforms and STP (Straight Through Processing) journeys for faster loan approvals.
Risk Mindset: Ability to identify "red flags" in business proposals to prevent fraud.
Responsibilities:
Business Acquisition: Achieving top-line targets by sourcing loan proposals through branches and connectors.
Portfolio Management: Managing the entire lifecycle of a loanfrom the initial "Login" to the final "Disbursement" and subsequent "Renewals."
Relationship Building: Deepening relationships with branch managers to get quality leads and cross-selling products like Insurance, ForeX, and CMS.
Credit Coordination: Working closely with the Credit & Operations teams to get files sanctioned and resolve queries.
Asset Quality: Monitoring the health of your portfolio, ensuring timely interest servicing, and managing DPD (Days Past Due) to prevent NPAs.
Digital Adoption: Moving customers toward digital platforms like Project Neo and Business App for a seamless banking experience.
Skills: SME Banking, Working Capital Management, Business Acquisition, Credit Risk Assessment, Term Loans, SBB Sales, Relationship Management, Stakeholder Management, Financial Analysis.

Interview Type: Proficiency in local market knowledge & Credit basics
Company Description: HFFC is a technology-driven housing finance company that focuses on providing home loans to first-time buyers in the low and middle-income segments. They are known for their fast processing times and were listed on the stock exchange in 2021. Their mission is to simplify the journey to homeownership for people who may not have extensive formal documentation.
Job Description: As a Relationship Manager at HFFC, you are a "street-smart go-getter." You don't wait for customers to come to the branch; you go out into the community to find them. Your role is a blend of financial counseling and salesyou help customers calculate their eligibility based on their informal or formal income and guide them through the emotional and technical process of buying their first home.
Requirements:
Experience: 2+ years in field sales (Retail, Insurance, or Banking).
Personality: Self-driven, energetic, and comfortable with extensive field visits.
Relationship Skills: Ability to build trust with local connectors (builders, contractors, and brokers).
Communication: Proficiency in the local language is essential to explain complex loan terms to first-time buyers.
Responsibilities:
Lead Generation: Identifying and meeting potential customers through local marketing activities and "naka" meetings.
Customer Profiling: Understanding a customer's family income (even from informal sources) to suggest the best loan product.
Documentation: Assisting customers in gathering the necessary KYC and income proofs to start the loan application.
Channel Management: Building a network of local influencers (connectors) who can refer home loan seekers to you.
Collections: Ensuring that the customers you onboarded pay their EMIs on time, maintaining a healthy portfolio for the branch.
End-to-End Service: Handholding the customer from the first meeting until the final check is handed over to the builder seller.
Skills: New Business Development, Retail Sales, Mortgage Sales (Home Loans), Relationship Management, Field Marketing, Collections Management, Credit Assessment Basics, Channel Sales, Local Area Mapping.

Company Description: Adani Total Gas is a leader in City Gas Distribution (CGD), developing networks to supply Piped Natural Gas (PNG) to domestic, commercial, and industrial segments, and Compressed Natural Gas (CNG) for the transport sector.
Job Description: As the Project Manager for the Bhandara GA, you are the strategic lead for the entire gas utility infrastructure. This is a high-impact leadership role that combines heavy civil mechanical construction with utility operations and strategic financial planning. You are responsible for building the city's "gas backbone"from the City Gate Station (CGS) where gas is received at high pressure, to the "last mile" connectivity in kitchens and factories.
Requirements:
Technical Expertise: Deep knowledge of Steel and PE (Polyethylene) pipeline laying, welding standards, and Cathodic Protection (CP) systems.
Industry Background: Solid experience in City Gas Distribution (CGD) or Oil & Energy utilities.
Managerial Skills: Strong background in Project Life Cycle management, including budgeting, vendor negotiation, and stakeholder liaison (obtaining PWD NHAI permissions).
Responsibilities:
Infrastructure Construction: Supervise the rollout of high-pressure grids and the installation of City Gate Stations (CGS). You must optimize the network using Loop Systems (for reliability) over Tree systems.
Technical Quality Control: Manage specialized processes like electrofusion for PE pipes and the use of Gas Chromatographs at stations to monitor gas quality.
Operations & Maintenance (O&M): Oversee pressure reduction, filtration, and odorization (adding smell to gas for safety). Implement Cathodic Protection to prevent underground pipeline corrosion.

Company Description: The Hosteller is one of India's fastest-growing backpacker hostel chains with over 50 locations. You are responsible for both the Front of House (FOH)the guest experience, vibe, and serviceand the Back of House (BOH)the kitchen, inventory, and cost control. At Kartscale Technologies, a subsidiary of the Maverick Hat Group, we are not just a performance marketing agency; we are your growth partners in the ever-evolving world of digital commerce. The role provides direct exposure to performance marketing strategies, ad management, and content creation within a fast-paced agency environment.
